name: direhaggis
text: Achewood does Noir. Fits.

name: afkpuz
text: This is one of my favorite strips, for some bizzare reason.

name: sargasm
text: Who's the dude in the background picture in panel 3?  IS IT CHRIS ONSTAD????

name: hollis
text: Dude that would be so clever!  Never allow photographs of himself to get out there, then slip one into one of his strips!  If J.D. Salinger had been a cartoonist, he probably would have done this.

name: zedpower
text: The poster says "no", so that's probably somebody else.

name: anniqu3
text: I don't think so, he has tall ears.

name: tragicone
text: http://www.avclub.com/content/files/images/Chris-Onstad.article.jpg

name: ravindra108
text: Unfortunately, that url is no longer current. Here is the new one.

name: ford
text: I think it looks like Johnny Depp, but i've been wrong before

name: rykan
text: That's exactly what I was thinking...

name: ham_shoes
text: I think it's Judd Nelson.

name: robocop
text: yogi bear

name: biddlebubbly
text: Is this the only time beef wears that black shirt? My vote: probably.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: I'm surprised in a warm way that his shirt confidence has risen, if perhaps momentarily, enough for sleevelessness.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: orrrr issss itttt?

name: nathanielperson
text: Dig the Tenmen poster. Was this their first time in the strip?

name: junko
text: Yeah, I think the first appearance of The Smoke as well.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Emeril and Spongebath think the lonely life is preferable to the thousand natural shocks the flesh is heir to.

name: soticoto
text: ... I'm getting the sudden urge to say "Boo to that! ... but I'd rather not stoop that far into hypocrisy.

name: kilroywashere
text: Kid thinks the moon landing was faked; no wonder he's giving Beef bad advice about marriage.

name: cdtm
text: Just because they're against marriage, doesn't mean they don't play the flesh game.  ^_~

name: godfatherofsouls
text: this would surprise me, but hell, good for them if so

name: riazm
text: I recall Spongebath getting a tug job at one of Ray's parties.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Panel two breaks the 180 rule. :[

name: geysershitdick
text: what does this mean?

name: geysershitdick
text: Sorry guys, I just realized that google is my friend. Lame this terrible man.

name: choosebro
text: Don't be so down on yourself, man.

name: dtuba
text: Meh, everyone does that these days. 180 degree rule practically extinct anyway.

name: epicurus
text: I wouldn't have respected Emeril's advice if he hadn't admitted that the tears do come. Though not often. It almost sounds like a good idea (until you try it)

name: ceres
text:
Until you try... not getting married? Or did I completely misunderstand you?
Frankly, much like is stated in the alt text, I don't see what's so bad about not getting married. It certainly isn't worth any tears.

name: epicurus
text:
Yes, until you try not getting married, or swearing off the opposite sex (at least as a man swearing off women).

Personally I don't intend to get married, but if you stay single long enough you WILL wish things were different and end up fucking a lobster shell that you heated with your coffee maker.

Right guys?

name: spenham
text: Your comment (and indeed, all your comments) are so much more awesome when read in the voice of your Sealab guy.

name: farqussus
text:
survey says...

BYA-BYOWWWWWWWWWWWWWW

name: ham_shoes
text: Johnny Paycheck couldn't have said it better.  Or at least not in the style of Cotton Mather.

name: kamet
text: This. Is. My. Favorite. Strip. Period.

name: diggydow
text: Does "particlar" mean something or did Onstad seriously make a spelling error?

name: ragnarok_engine
text: Nah. It is but a dialectical thing, dogg.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Yeah...he also wrote "fanceyful"

name: srikamaraja
text: I wish every sentence I spoke went through the Emeril Literary Verbosity filter.

name: ham_shoes
text: I like how Emeril talks like someone who lived in the original thirteen colonies.
